Here's a question for a math student to solve:

Suppose you are given a non-monotonic logical system with 100 propositional variables. At the start of the system, all variables are assigned the value 'false'. You are then given a set of 50 rules that can change the truth value of some of these variables. Each rule has a certainty level between 0 and 1, indicating how confident you are in the rule. The logical system is non-monotonic, which means that the truth value of a variable may change as new rules are added to the system.

Your task is to determine which variables will have a truth value of 'true' when all 50 rules have been added to the system, assuming that the system is closed (i.e., no new rules will be added after the initial set of 50). You can assume that the system will stop changing after a certain number of rules have been added, although you do not know in advance how many rules this will be.

Given this information, what is the probability that variable A will have a truth value of 'true' at the end of the system, and what is the probability that variable B will have a truth value of 'true' at the end of the system?
